page.title: 09Social Concerns.
page.content: Part of the area north of the M57 motorway, is a large overspill estate called Hattersley. The people who live there were rehoused from Manchester, the first moving into their new houses over 14 years ago. The Housing policy at the time, which moved people from familiar, though very poor housing, areas, was controversial. Some of the people who moved there did so because they wanted to. Some, however, were forced by Local Councils to make the move; i.e. they were rehoused outside their own neighbourhoods. Originally the area was farmland, mainly pasture. Today there are still dairy cattle in fields around the estate, and some arable land to the north of the M57. Today there is a thriving Community Group on the estate who try to support those who live there.
